channel.title: Issue running client
channel.description: ok so, i've never worked on a rsc before, ive used 317, 474 and a little 508 so im using easyRSC and when i try to run it, it says "'ant' is not recognized as an internal or external command, operavle program or batch file. Press any key to continue...." once i use edit it shows, and yes i did type in the correct jdk [code]@echo off set PATH=%PATH%;C:\apache-ant-1.7.0\bin set JAVA_HOME=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_20 ant runclient pause[/code] soo uhh if someone could tell me what to do id appreciate it :D

item.title: Issue running client

item.description:

item.title: Issue running client
item.dc:creator: @TehpureOwner TehpureOwner
item.description:
@TehpureOwner wrote:

[quote=“Kryptix, post:2, topic:351518”]You need to define your paths to wherever you installed Apache Ant.[/quote] Thank you so much! i did it :DD so now how do i make myself owner?

item.title: Issue running client
item.dc:creator: @TehpureOwner TehpureOwner
item.description:
@TehpureOwner wrote:

You need to install Apache Ant. Google for instructions.

OK, OK, OK so heres the thing. i downloaded apache ant 1.8.1 and i edited my client, it now shows

@echo off set PATH=%PATH%;C:\apache-ant-1.8.1\bin set JAVA_HOME=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_20 ant runclient pause

but then it still pops up saying

'ant' is not recognized as an internal or external command, operable program or batch file. Press any key to continue...

Read full topic

@TehpureOwner wrote:

ok so, i’ve never worked on a rsc before, ive used 317, 474 and a little 508 so im using easyRSC and when i try to run it, it says
“‘ant’ is not recognized as an internal or external command, operavle program or batch file. Press any key to continue…” once i use edit it shows, and yes i did type in the correct jdk

@echo off set PATH=%PATH%;C:\apache-ant-1.7.0\bin set JAVA_HOME=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_20 ant runclient pause soo uhh if someone could tell me what to do id appreciate it
